The function of dates is to tonify the spleen and stomach, which tastes sweet and is neutral in nature, and is tonified to the large intestine and urinary bladder meridians. translation2: Today, let's take a look at some "Strange Hot Searches". What is the normal public opinion? Randomly select three hot searches: February 2 Dragon Head Raised, Hua Liu Friend Price Hike, and the Goods Lala Incident. Public opinion spreads and forms a peak, then "the index drops" (smooth curve) and eventually dissipates. If secondary public opinion emerges, there will be a small peak again. They look exactly the same as the "Network Opinion Evolution Model" displayed on the website of the Cyberspace Administration of China. What is abnormal public opinion? Randomly select six hot searches from the same event and present them in "peak", "sawtooth", and "cliff" shapes. "Peak" means human-induced heating, quickly climbing the hot search rankings and attracting public attention; "Sawtooth" means periodic heating, ensuring that the topic stays on the hot search rankings; "Cliff" means collective withdrawal, the hot search fulfilling its "function" and being assigned to a new task, moving towards a new battlefield. In Figure 9, the peak of one event's heat wave exactly matches the valley of another event, with time difference of only a few seconds, which must be the Cyberspace Administration of China receiving a task and launching a new round of attacks. The professionalism of black public relations can be seen in a few spots: several hot searches at the same time, which ones attract attention, which ones are responsible for popularization, which ones incite war, which ones divert attention, which ones affect cognition, which ones lead to wrong judgments, which ones arouse emotions, which ones mislead judgment, which ones provoke emotions, which ones encircle and suppress decisions, and black accounts are divided into batches and fine-tuned at different nodes. Almost all factors involved in the spread and diffusion of public opinion are considered. Dissemination is a science, and black public relations also has nowhere to hide when it comes to objective data. Data source: Hot Search Time Machine.

translation2: Is the foot bath tank leaking electricity? Can the right foot bath tank bring health benefits? Today, the editors of Country美小编 will answer this question and hope to be helpful to friends. With the enhancement of people's health awareness, foot bath tanks are increasingly favored by consumers, and a variety of products with different specifications have emerged on the market, ranging from hundreds of yuan to thousands of yuan, providing consumers with a wide range of choices. According to relevant data, compared with traditional household appliances, foot bath tanks and other health-related household appliances are selling like hotcakes, but there is no specific industry standard for foot bath tanks, so there are certain safety risks. "It's too dangerous to soak your feet in electric water, isn't it?" Mr. Li told the reporter. Recently, he bought a foot bath tank as a gift for his father's birthday, but his father felt numbness in his feet after soaking them. At first, Mr. Li thought it was due to the vibration function of the foot bath tank, but when he turned off the vibration function, his father still felt numbness. Mr. Li tried writing with a pen, and to his surprise, the pen lit up. Mr. Li was shocked to discover that the water in the foot bath tank was electric. Later, he contacted the store, and although the store was willing to refund the foot bath tank, Mr. Li still felt unhappy. Because he found that this popular foot bath tank, which has been around for a long time, lacks clear and detailed industry standards in terms of the highest temperature setting, applicable user groups, materials, and safety guarantees. However, in general, foot bath tanks do not have electricity problems, but there is a small number of products that may not have been strictly inspected during production. Therefore, when purchasing, choose a disassembled foot bath tank. Water and electricity are separated, and there are no safety risks. At the same time, you can take a pen to test.

translation2: Education News: The admission rate for middle school talented students in Beijing was reduced in early 2016. According to reports on May 21 and 22, the admission work for middle school talented students in Beijing was organized and carried out unified by the education departments of various districts. This year, the admission rate for talented students in Beijing's various districts has been reduced, and the competition among talented students has become more intense. For example, in Chongwen District, the admission rate for primary school students to enter middle school as talented students was generally less than 5% of the planned enrollment of the district, with a planned enrollment of 380 people. The enrollment ratio was also generally less than 10% of the school's planned enrollment. Students with sports, art, and science and technology talents who have registered online are eligible to participate in the talented student admission examination. To facilitate students' nearby participation in the examination, Chongwen District has continued the examination arrangement of last year and set up 1-2 examination points in each school, a total of 13 examination points. The examination points are respectively divided into examination areas according to the examination area, and the time is divided into hours for each area, and the students will enter the examination points in different examination areas according to the examination time and take the examination in the different examination areas. On May 23, the Beijing Municipal Education Admission Test Center announced the list of students who passed the examination through the website, and students can query the examination results on the website.

translation2: The Yangtze River's mainstream has realized the full coverage of water-based green integrated service areas. Xinhua Net, December 11, 2022. Chongqing's Wushan Water-based Green Integrated Service Area was completed and put into operation on the 10th, becoming the second water-based green integrated service area on the upper reaches of the Yangtze River after the Yizhuang Water-based Green Integrated Service Area in Chongqing was put into operation on the 8th. With this, water-based green integrated service areas have covered the upper, middle, and lower reaches of the Yangtze River. The Ministry of Transport's Yangtze River Navigation Administration Bureau's deputy director, Qi Junhua, introduced that before this, provinces such as Hubei, Hunan, Jiangxi, Anhui, and Jiangsu had built and put into operation 10 water-based green integrated service areas on the middle and lower reaches of the Yangtze River, which were recognized by a wide range of ship crews and played an important role in promoting the high-quality development of Yangtze River navigation. The full coverage of water-based green integrated service areas on the Yangtze River is another milestone event in the construction of green navigation on the Yangtze River, and it has significantly improved the reception of Yangtze River ship pollutants and the service capabilities of navigation. According to introductions, water-based green integrated service areas are an important facility for providing comprehensive production, life, and public services to ships and ship crews, helping ship crews solve the "urgent, difficult, and worried" problem. The two water-based green integrated service areas on the upper reaches of the Yangtze River that were put into operation this time are integrated with life, production, and public services, with green environmental protection as the main theme and ship maintenance and emergency rescue services as the highlight, realizing "one-stop docking and multiple services" for inland ships, making it easier for ship crews to work and live on the Yangtze River.

translation2: What is the drinking method of Red Label whisky? Everyone's taste is different, some people like to collect, some people like to eat, of course, there are also people who like to drink. Red Label whisky is one of the best-selling Scottish whiskies in various countries, and it has also won a gold medal at the International Wine and Spirit Competition. Each bottle of Red Label whisky has a unique taste, but if you don't know how to appreciate it, wouldn't it be a waste of its fragrant aroma? Then how should Red Label whisky be drunk? The editor will introduce it to everyone simply.  Drinking method of Red Label whisky: Golden amber pours into the glass, with aromas of vanilla, caramel, and smoky peat moss. The taste is rich and smooth, with a hint of sweetness and a smoky aftertaste. This whisky can be enjoyed on its own or mixed with your favorite drink. When Red Label whisky was introduced to China, to suit the taste of Chinese people, Red Label whisky + Coca-Cola, Sprite, or New Coke became a fashionable drink that lasts forever. These sweet drinks not only neutralize the acidity, but also visually bring happiness to people, adding the drink, it can change the taste of the mouth.  Red Label whisky + lemon slice + sugar (sand sugar can also be used), is the most authentic and traditional way to drink. The taste of the genuine Red Label whisky is slightly sour, and adding sugar can neutralize its sour taste. Lemon will give the whisky a refreshing aroma, of course, the sweet-sour taste can be adjusted according to personal taste. The above three are the best ways to drink Red Label whisky, and everyone can try them as references, hoping that the editor's introduction can help everyone.

translation2: The first contemporary art biennial exhibition in Saudi Arabia was held in the Diriyah JAX Art Zone in the northwest of the capital Riyadh. A total of 64 artists from Saudi Arabia, China, and other regions participated in the exhibition. The exhibition was co-organized by the Saudi Diriyah Biennial Foundation and the UCCA Center for Contemporary Art in Beijing. UCCA Center for Contemporary Art Director Tian Weituo served as the art director of the exhibition. According to the curatorial team, the theme of this biennial exhibition is "Touching the Stone and Crossing the River," which reflects the reform strategies adopted during the period of social and economic transformation and the current situation of cultural development in Saudi Arabia. The exhibition covers an area of nearly 12,000 square meters and is composed of six interconnected buildings, presenting six units: "Touching the Stone and Crossing the River," "Tradition as Experiment," "Edge Thinking," "Towards the Public," "Beautiful New World," and "On the Spirit of Art." Among them, the number of works by 27 Saudi Arabian artists accounts for more than four-fifths of the total number of works, covering painting, installation art, and performance art, etc. Twelve Chinese artists' works are also well-received, some of whom use recycled materials in innovative ways, such as Xu Bing's "The Story Behind the Mountains Is Endless" series (2014), which reconstructs a classic landscape painting with discarded objects. Diriyah Biennial Foundation Chairman Bakkali said he hoped that this biennial exhibition could establish an international dialogue, allowing audiences around the world to understand the vibrant cultural industry and creative community in Saudi Arabia and strengthen exchanges and interactions. Tian Weituo said, "The goal of the biennial exhibition is double-edged, allowing Saudi Arabian contemporary art to participate in the global dialogue and allowing Saudi Arabian audiences to enter the world of contemporary art." It is reported that during the opening week of the exhibition, a series of lectures will be held, and opinion leaders in the fields of art, curators, and the creative industry will discuss topics such as cross-cultural communication and the development of contemporary art.

translation2: In September 2020, Mr. Liu learned about a factory building located in Shaoxing Town, Yongjia County, Zhejiang Province from an agent. After visiting the site multiple times, Mr. Liu decided to buy the factory building. In December of the same year, after negotiating with the owner's family member Ms. Lin regarding the details of the purchase, Mr. Liu transferred 200,000 yuan as a deposit by bank transfer. Ms. Lin signed the "Factory Building Purchase and Sale Deposit Receipt" as the payee, stating that if the buyer did not want to buy the factory building, the deposit would be returned to the seller, and if the seller did not want to sell the factory building, the deposit would be returned to the buyer, and both parties agreed to sign a factory building purchase and sale contract within a week. However, due to the failure of both parties to reach an agreement on the main terms of the contract, such as the sales range and payment method, the factory building purchase and sale contract was never signed. After several days, Ms. Lin returned the deposit of 200,000 yuan to Mr. Liu. It was difficult for Mr. Liu to find a suitable house, paid the deposit, and was ready to sign the contract, but the seller did not sell the house, which made Mr. Liu helpless and angry. Therefore, Mr. Liu filed a lawsuit against Ms. Lin in Yongjia City People's Court. The court held that the parties ultimately failed to sign a formal contract and could not solely blame the defendant. The court ruled that the defendant did not need to bear the responsibility of returning double the deposit. After the first instance ruling, the plaintiff filed an appeal. Recently, the second instance court maintained the original judgment. [Legal Reminder] In the transaction process, it is necessary to fulfill the necessary caution and attention obligations. When signing a contract, as the buyer, it is necessary to fulfill the necessary caution and attention obligations, such as verifying the information of the property owner, whether the property is occupied, and clearly stating the specific time and place of delivery in the contract to avoid disputes between the parties when the contract is performed.

They also pressured the reviewer to pay a deposit upfront, claiming that it would be difficult to get the money back once it was paid. The reviewer fell for this trap and paid a deposit of over 10,000 yuan. The company's quote had many problems, as it did not include the cost of water and electricity upgrades, bathroom renovations, or the cost of doors and cabinets, which are essential for basic renovations. The company's service fees were also higher than those of other companies. The reviewer lost trust in the company and signed a contract without fully understanding the terms. When the reviewer tried to get their money back, the company acted like they were experienced and had a special team to deal with customers. They blamed the customer for all the problems and refused to take responsibility. The reviewer warns others not to choose this company, as their friend's renovation project with the same company also had poor quality, and they were later charged for various fees. The reviewer concludes that the company is a scam and advises others to do their research and consult with experts before choosing a renovation company, as renovations can be expensive.

According to a report from China's Xinhua News Agency, to strengthen the team of teachers in rural areas and ensure the balanced development of compulsory education, Jiangxi Province plans to train 1,000 music, art, and physical education teachers for rural primary schools within the next three years. Starting from 2016, the province will select and train one music, art, and physical education teacher for each rural primary school with a population of under 45 years old who have a basic knowledge or talent in these fields and can teach other subjects as well. The training will help them master the basic knowledge and skills of teaching music, art, and physical education, update their teaching ideas and concepts, learn modern teaching methods, improve their teaching ability, activity design ability, campus culture ability, and self-development ability, and build a team of multi-talented music, art, and physical education teachers to alleviate the shortage of such teachers in rural areas. To ensure the quality and effectiveness of the training, Jiangxi Province also plans to train 300 teachers for music, art, and physical education in 100 counties (cities, districts) across the province, with a total of 1,000 trainees, to enhance their teaching demonstration leadership ability, teaching research activity organization ability, teaching ability, and network training workshop construction ability, and play the role of teaching, demonstrating, guiding, and supervising.

The function of dates is to tonify the spleen and stomach, which tastes sweet and is neutral in nature, and is tonified to the large intestine and urinary bladder meridians. The function of Job's tears is to tonify the liver and kidneys, which tastes sweet and is neutral in nature, and is tonified to the liver and kidney meridians. translation2: The State Council's Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism recently issued a notice requiring the strengthening of epidemic prevention and control measures in border cities within 48 hours of obtaining a negative nucleic acid test result. Those traveling to border cities from outside the country must take a nucleic acid test within 48 hours of departure and undergo at least one nucleic acid test upon arrival. The time range for this requirement is from the date of confirmation of the border city by each province, autonomous region, and municipality directly under the Central Government to March 15, 2022. In addition, border cities with conditions can study the establishment of a buffer zone for epidemic prevention and control. The National Health Commission's Disease Prevention and Control Office said that for some border cities, cross-border trade is the main economic pillar, and people from both sides travel frequently. Implementing differentiated management policies will turn one line of defense into two lines of defense, which can achieve the goal of controlling the spread of the epidemic by closing the border and reducing the risk of epidemic spillover, with the minimum social impact and the lowest social cost. Recently, several domestic cluster outbreaks have occurred, all of which were imported from abroad through border cities. The notice pointed out that some places have problems with the timely monitoring and warning of epidemics, the closed-loop management of high-risk positions, the formalism of regular nucleic acid testing, the insufficient disinfection of cold-chain products, the unstandardized management of centralized isolation facilities, and the insufficient scientific and accurate handling of epidemic control. The notice requires efforts to be made from nine aspects, including improving the mechanism for border city epidemic prevention and control, strengthening the monitoring and early warning system for epidemics, implementing border control measures, and publishing and promoting the hotline for ensuring people's livelihood security. Border cities are required to study epidemic prevention and control in parallel with ensuring people's livelihood security, publish and promote the hotline for ensuring people's livelihood security, regularly check the emergence of problems such as the supply and price of basic necessities, and proactively respond to prominent issues raised by the public. The scope of the border cities mentioned in the notice includes the counties (cities, districts, and banners) where land, water, and air border ports are located, as well as the prefecture-level cities, municipalities, and autonomous regions where they are located, and the directly-administered municipalities. The specific scope shall be determined by each province (autonomous region, and directly-administered municipality) based on the needs of epidemic prevention and control and announced in a timely manner.

translation2: A coalition of 130 Asian-American groups filed a complaint with the U.S. Department of Education and the Justice Department on May 23, protesting against the admission discrimination faced by three Ivy League schools - Harvard University, Brown University, and Dartmouth College - in their recruitment process. The coalition held a press conference in Washington on the same day to announce the complaint. The coalition's chairman, Zhao Yuxuan, said at the press conference that the number of Asian-American applicants who meet the admission criteria of these three U.S. universities has increased tenfold in the past decade, but their proportion in these universities has basically remained at the same level. Many studies have shown that these universities discriminate against Asian-American applicants in the so-called "holistic consideration" admission process, which is "long-term and systematically discriminating against Asian-American applicants." Zhao Yuxuan introduced that a study by Sanders and others in 2014 showed that in these three universities, the relative number of applicants, Asian-Americans had the lowest admission rate among all ethnic groups. Data from the U.S. Department of Education also showed that among the members of the Ivy League, Brown University and Dartmouth College had the lowest admission rate for Asian-American students, while Harvard University and Brown University had been practicing de facto racial quotas for Asian-American students for over 20 years. Zhao Yuxuan told reporters from China News Service that they hoped that after submitting the complaint, the U.S. Department of Education and the Justice Department would investigate and take measures to stop these three universities from continuing to discriminate against Asian-American students in their admission process. They also hoped that the universities would proactively address this issue and change their admission policies towards Asian-American students. Currently, the three universities have not responded to the complaint. The Asian-American Education Union was established in 2015 and had previously filed a complaint against Harvard University's admission discrimination, but the U.S. Department of Education did not accept the complaint due to procedural reasons. This time, in addition to the Chinese-American groups, the coalition also included American Indian, Korean, Japanese, and Pakistani-American educational organizations.

translation2: The joint drill "Peaceful Relief-2021" between the Chinese and Vietnamese militaries has successfully concluded. All participating Chinese troops have safely returned to their base in Guangxi, marking the successful completion of the 7-day training mission.  During this joint exercise, the Chinese and Vietnamese militaries focused on the topic of humanitarian medical relief and tightly adhered to their mission of guarding and treating the wounded. They completed joint command and control, on-site rescue, and mass treatment of casualties according to realistic standards, effectively enhancing their joint medical support capabilities.  The results of the exercise have been recognized by both countries' militaries. The director of the Vietnamese exercise guidance committee, the deputy chief of the Vietnamese Army Logistics Department, and Colonel Nguyen Hung Son said that through this exercise, Vietnamese doctors have learned about the organization and professional activities of Chinese doctors, as well as China's medical and support equipment. The results of the exercise demonstrate the professional capabilities of both countries' medical forces in medical assistance and epidemic prevention.  The Chinese guidance and coordination team leader and the deputy director of the Central Military Commission's Logistics Support Department said that this exercise was another innovative practice based on the successful holding of a joint triage activity in 2018, with significant milestone significance. During the exercise, the Chinese People's Liberation Army donated medical protective masks, medical protective suits, and rapid nucleic acid testing equipment to the Vietnamese People's Army.
